prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: Whilethere are some idols who still keep their vigorous celebrity andinfluential powers.

definition: old but vigorous (idiom); hale and hearty despite the years

(of one's skills, appearance etc) not to have deteriorated a bit/to be as (good, vigorous etc) as ever
lit. an old steed in the stable still aspires to gallop 1000 miles (idiom); fig. aged person with great aspirations
ginger gets spicier as it gets older (idiom)/the older, the wiser

elderly
to have qualified successors to carry on one's undertaking
to be in the prime of life
to seem to grow younger/to regain one's youthful looks

definition: to admit to one's advancing years/to acquiesce to old age
